ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 8 hours
12 hours if we have a assignment that week
Approximately 8 hours
Approximately 6-10 hours per week.
more than 10 hours
12 hours or more
~8-10 hours per week
8 hours
10 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Strengths: both theoretical and computational knowledge
Strength: Go through the toolbox of learning statistic models Weakness: A bit too quick in second half semester
The materials are interesting and Prof. Crawford did an awesome job making it understandable. This is the course that benefits me the most for the first semester here.

Overall, this class is excellent. This course covers important topics in computational statistics and is taught in a very clear and concise manner. The homeworks and exams are still challenging despite the straightforward teaching, but for the most part, the assignments/questions are reasonable.
Overall a very useful course. The instructor is excellent. The lecture is clear and makes sense. The workload is heavy, but it's worth it. In conclusion, an excellent course!
very helpful and useful
The assessments are useful

Prof Crawford's lectures are very clear and easy to understand. The lectures covers many interesting topics in computational methods. It can be better if the professor can provide more examples or even extra notes regarding each of the lecture topics.
clear logic; theory-practice combined
Competent very useful, but also hard because there isn't enough time to digest each part of the content

I like it that the professor uses the blackboard instead of the slides. It would be better if the professor can give us a little general idea before each class and give us a conclusion after each class.
Homework problems are well designed.
This is a great course, which teaches really practical things. The course is hard, but is definitely worth the time and effort.

It was often frustrating that the topics introduced in lectures were quite simple and easy to understand, but the homeworks seemed to be in a completely different dimension in terms of difficulty. I understand that you'll never learn anything if you aren't challenged, and I agree with this, but I feel that you also don't learn anything if what you're doing is over your head. I could go through the motions all day and still not understand what I was doing, and maybe this is my own fault, but I think lessening the jump between a simple lecture and a seemingly impossible homework would have improved my understanding of the material. Most of the problem for me was not that the concepts were difficult, but that I was unable to work through the logic to set the problem up before I could even get to the computational part. Again, this is probably just a deficit on my part, and of course real life problems are never this simple, but I always felt there was a barrier between me and the material because I could never work through the probabilistic logic.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Offers great help when we have problems, explaining definitions and algorithms clearly and patiently
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Very nice and patient!
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Great instructor, perfect manner, and also a charming scholar.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  The instructor is very clear and straightforward. He does an excellent job explaining the concepts of this course.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  The instructor is excellent. He talks in a clear way, and his lecture is easy to follow, even though we are talking about something very complicated.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  He is good in teaching the course in general. One improvement could be to provide more concrete examples in demonstrating important concepts and algorithms.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  He is a very nice teacher. We all love him ;)
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  He is an excellent lecturer who is good at giving intuitions and very clear explanations about the materials in lectures.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  The instructor interact well with students; clear presentation; good to use blackboard; ensure everyone in the same pace;
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Professor Crawford teaches in a very standard and clear style. Office hours are very helpful.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  less typo
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Very responsible. Good at explaining things very clearly.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Great teacher and an extremely knowledgable statistician!

Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Dr. Crawford always had clear and straightforward lectures and was easy to understand and communicate with. He was very patient and helpful during office hours. I also appreciated his dry sense of humor even though it was often lost on most of the class.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Practically useful. Yes, I will recommend this course.
Good even for students with majors apart from stat or biostat!
It might appear to be a little difficult while it's definitely worth your time.
I would recommend this class to another student.
Highly recommended. A very useful course, and you can learn a lot!
Great class but could be challenging
This is a very great course. I recommend it to other students. Thanks Professor Crawford teaching us so much.
Highly recommend if you want to learn algorithm, combine theory with practice.
Recommended for upperclassmen for its difficulty, but content is useful. Great professor and TA.
Good course. Help you to better understand the underlying mechanisms of some statistical problems
Yes. This course is very useful in practice.
Would highly recommend, but be prepared to work a lot.

Concepts are simple and easy to understand but homeworks are convoluted and difficult applications of the material. I would *only* recommend to students with incredibly strong math backgrounds in probability and mathematical statistics. Basic coding skills in R are not enough and you need to be prepared to write more advanced scripts to keep up in the course.
